verses.text: 信就是對所盼望的事的把握，是看不見之事的明證。

words.note: Indicates the object of a verb or refers to what is acted upon.
Similar to modern '的', often used in classical Chinese.

verses.text: 因著這信心，古人得到了稱許。
因著信，我們就明白宇宙（「宇宙」或譯：「諸世界」或「眾世代」）是因著 神的話造成的。這樣，那看得見的就是從那看不見的造出來的。

words.note: Lit. 'space and time'.

verses.text: 因著信，亞伯比該隱獻上更美的祭品給 神；藉著這信心，他被 神稱許為義人，這是 神指著他的禮物所作的見證；他雖然死了，卻藉著信仍然說話。

words.note: Indicates the object of a verb or refers to what is acted upon.

verses.text: 因著信，以諾被遷去了，使他不至於死，人也找不著他，因為 神把他遷去了。原來在遷去以前，他已經得了 神喜悅他的明證。

words.note: A common potential complement structure meaning 'unable to find'.
Indicates the object of the verb that follows.

verses.text: 沒有信，就不能得到 神的喜悅；因為來到 神面前的人，必須信 神存在，並且信他會賞賜那些尋求他的人。

words.note: The leading space is a traditional mark of reverence.
The leading space is a traditional mark of reverence.
The leading space is a traditional mark of reverence.

verses.text: 因著信，挪亞在還沒有看見的事上，得了 神的警告，就動了敬畏的心，做了一艘方舟，使他全家得救。藉著這信心，他就定了那世代的罪，自己也承受了那因信而來的義。

words.note: Used as a suffix to mean 'in the aspect of' or 'regarding'.
Indicates completed action or change of state.
The leading space is a traditional mark of reverence.
Indicates completed action or change of state.
A respectful fear, awe towards God.
Indicates completed action or change of state.
Refers to Noah's Ark.
Indicates completed action or change of state.
Indicates completed action or change of state.
Connects clauses, showing result or consequence.

verses.text: 因著信，亞伯拉罕在蒙召的時候，就聽命往他將要承受為業的地方去；他出去的時候，還不知道要往哪裡去。

words.note: Lit. 'receive a call'.

verses.text: 因著信，他在應許之地寄居，好像是在異鄉，與承受同樣應許的以撒、雅各一樣住在帳棚裡。

words.note: Classical Chinese possessive particle, equivalent to modern '的'.

verses.text: 因為他等待那座有根基的城，就是 神所設計所建造的。

words.note: The leading space is a traditional mark of reverence.
Forms a nominal phrase indicating 'that which is V-ed'.
Forms a nominal phrase indicating 'that which is V-ed'.

verses.text: 因著信，甚至撒拉，她雖然過了生育的年齡，還是能夠懷孕，因為她認為那應許她的是信實的。

words.note: Here indicates 'the one who...'

verses.text: 所以從一個好像已死的人，竟然生出許多子孫來，仿佛天上的星那麼眾多，海邊的沙那麼無數。

words.note: Refers to both sons and grandsons, thus offspring/descendants.

verses.text: 這些人都是存著信心死了的，還沒有得著所應許的，只不過是從遠處看見，就表示歡迎，又承認他們在世上是異鄉人，是客旅。

words.note: Resultative complement 着 (zháo) indicates successful attainment.
Introduces a passive clause or object of an action.
Forms a noun phrase from a verb, meaning 'that which was promised'.
Lit. 'different-hometown-person', a stranger or sojourner.
Refers to someone traveling or residing temporarily in a foreign land.

verses.text: 因為說這樣話的人，是表明他們在尋求一個家鄉。
如果他們懷念已經離開了的地方，還有可以回去的機會。
但是現在他們所嚮往的，是一個更美的、在天上的家鄉。所以， 神不以他們稱他為 神而覺得羞恥；因為他已經為他們預備了一座城。

words.note: Indicates a passive or what is done.
Refers to the divine being, often capitalized in Christian texts.

verses.text: 因著信，亞伯拉罕在受試驗的時候，就把以撒獻上；這就是那歡喜領受應許的人，獻上了自己的獨生子；
論到這個兒子，曾經有話說：「以撒生的，才可以稱為你的後裔。」
亞伯拉罕認定， 神能使人從死人中復活，因此，就喻意說，他的確從死裡得回他的兒子。

words.note: Refers to coming out of the state of death.

verses.text: 因著信，以撒給雅各和以掃祝福，論到將來的事。
因著信，雅各臨死的時候，分別為約瑟的兒子祝福，又倚著杖頭敬拜 神。
因著信，約瑟臨終的時候，提到以色列子民出埃及的事，並且為自己的骸骨留下遺言。

words.note: Similar to 臨死, but often implies the very end of life.
Often used in the Bible for 'God's people'.

verses.text: 因著信，摩西的父母在摩西生下來以後，因為看見孩子俊美，就把他藏了三個月，不怕王的命令。
因著信，摩西長大了以後，就拒絕被稱為法老女兒的兒子。
他寧願選擇和 神的子民一同受苦，也不肯享受罪惡中暫時的快樂。

words.note: Often used in the Bible for 'God's people'.

verses.text: 在他看來，為著基督受的凌辱，比埃及的財物更寶貴，因為他注視將來的賞賜。

words.note: Common in religious contexts for divine rewards.

verses.text: 因著信，他離開了埃及，不怕王的忿怒；因為他堅定不移，就像看見了人不能看見的 神。

words.note: Often refers to religious faith in scripture.
More formal or archaic than 生氣 for 'anger'.
A four-character idiom (chengyu).
Empty space used in some Chinese Bibles to emphasize 'God'.

verses.text: 因著信，他立了逾越節和灑血的禮，免得那滅命的侵犯以色列人的長子。

words.note: Often refers to religious faith in scripture.
Refers to the Jewish festival.
Refers to a ritual act.
Refers to the angel of death in this context.

verses.text: 因著信，他們走過了紅海，好像走過旱地一樣；埃及人也試著要過去，就被淹沒了。

words.note: Often refers to religious faith in scripture.

verses.text: 因著信，耶利哥的城牆被圍繞了七天，就倒塌了。

words.note: Often refers to religious faith in scripture.

verses.text: 因著信，妓女喇合和和平平接待了偵察的人，就沒有和那些不順從的人一起滅亡。

words.note: Can also mean 'trust' or 'believe'.
Reduplication of 和平 (peace) for emphasis.
Often implies military or intelligence scouting.
Implies moral or divine disobedience in context.
Often implies divine judgment or utter destruction.

verses.text: 我還要再說甚麼呢？如果再要述說基甸、巴拉、參孫、耶弗他、大衛、撒母耳和眾先知的事，時間就不夠了。

words.note: Often used to pluralize nouns, like 'all the people'.
Lit. 'one who knows/speaks before'.
Indicates a change of state or new situation.

verses.text: 他們藉著信，就戰勝了敵國，伸張了正義，得到了應許，堵住了獅子的口，

words.note: Often refers to God's divine promises.
The complement '住' indicates a firm stopping or fixing.

verses.text: 消滅了烈火的威力，逃脫了刀劍的鋒刃，軟弱變成剛強，在戰爭中顯出大能，把外國的軍隊擊退。

words.note: Acts as a noun 'the weak' in this context.
Often implies spiritual or divine strength.
Often refers to God's or supernaturally bestowed power.

verses.text: 有些婦女得回從死裡復活的親人；但也有些人忍受了酷刑，不肯接受釋放，為的是要得著更美的復活。

words.note: Commonly used in the biblical phrase '從死裡復活' (rise from the dead).
Connects a clause to its purpose.
Similar to 得到, often implying a deeper reception or realization.
In context, meaning 'better'.

verses.text: 又有些人遭受了戲弄、鞭打，甚至捆鎖、監禁；
被石頭打死，被鋸鋸死，（後期抄本在此加上「受試探」）被刀殺死。他們披著綿羊山羊的皮到處奔跑、受窮乏、遭患難、被虐待；

words.note: A specific phrase in biblical context.
Commonly used in biblical contexts to describe destitution.
A phrase frequently found in scripture.

verses.text: 原是這世界不配有的人。他們飄流無定，在曠野、山嶺、石洞和地穴棲身。
所有這些人都藉著信得了稱許，卻還沒有得著所應許的；

words.note: Often used in religious contexts to mean 'faith'.
Refers to receiving God's approval.
Refers to God's divine promises.

verses.text: 因為 神已經為我們預備了更美的事，使他們若不跟我們在一起，就不能完全。
